alert.note: Alert for Chase (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 29 at 12:29AM CDT until June 29 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM MDT FOR WESTERN CHASE COUNTY... At 1129 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Lamar, or 17 miles east of Holyoke, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Imperial, Lamar, Champion, Crete, Chase and Wanamaker State Wildfire Management Area. This includes Highway 61 between mile markers 41 and 48. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a dangerous storm, capable of producing large hail driven by severe winds! SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! If you are caught outdoors, cover your head and neck.
